DOC.brief_title: Risk Factors For Postoperative Respiratory Complications After Anesthesia
DOC.detailed_description: This retrospective project . Data use Quality Improvement database publication purpose . Data collect prospectively collect database do Quality Improvement Project . The study sit include post anesthesia care unit ( PACU ) main ambulatory campus hospital . The data collect surgical radiology PACU 's . Data collect quarter 2 week surgical PACU , 1 month Radiology PACU , Sep 2007 Mar 2012 . Trained perioperative nurse Certified Registered Nurse Anesthesiologist data collection . This ensured sample representative least 10 % patient anesthetized surgical radiological procedure . The independent variable ( risk factor ) collect included age , American Society Anesthesiology ( ASA ) physical status , obesity , preexist airway lung disease , preexist neuromuscular disease hypotonia , morbid obesity , intraoperative bronchospasm intraoperative laryngospasm . The primary outcome variable collect Apnea hypopnea , Laryngospasm , Bronchospasm , prolong Oxygen requirement . Apnea hypopnea define need bag mask ventilation , Laryngospasm requirement positive pressure ventilation > 20 cmH2O administration succinylcholine , Bronchospasm use albuterol , Oxygen requirement continue oxygen administration maintain SpO2 > 92 % 2 hour postoperatively .
